summary: This bill, the Protecting Minors in Federal Health Plans Act, aims to amend Title 5 of the United States Code to restrict coverage of gender-affirming care for individuals under 18 years old within the Federal Employees Health Benefits (FEHB) program. The bill defines gender-affirming care and specifies exceptions, including treatments for certain medical conditions and pre-existing hormone therapy regimens. It also addresses the applicability of the amendment to existing and renewed contracts.
